repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This fixes #3636 
This also obsoletes #3648 . #3648 was taken as a base. A test was added. Also @scoder 's feedback on that PR has been incorporated in this request. 

Thanks @webknjaz for providing the initial fix.

To make maintainer lives easier, I have only used os.path so it should be portable to the 0.29.x series as well that should be python 2.7 compatible. I volunteer to do so if this PR is merged.

comment_data.body:
Should this also normalize paths?
```suggestion
        matching_paths = zip(
            reversed(map(os.path.normpath, abs_no_ext.split(os.sep))),
            reversed(map(os.path.normpath, file_no_ext.split(os.sep))),
        )
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -41,6 +41,21 @@ def _find_dep_file_path(main_file, file_path, relative_path_search=False):
         rel_file_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(main_file), file_path)
         if os.path.exists(rel_file_path):
             abs_path = os.path.abspath(rel_file_path)
+
+        abs_no_ext = os.path.splitext(abs_path)[0]
+        file_no_ext, extension = os.path.splitext(file_path)
+        # We check if the paths match by matching the directories in reverse order.
+        # pkg/module.pyx /long/absolute_path/bla/bla/site-packages/pkg/module.c should match.
+        # this will match the pairs: module-module and pkg-pkg. After which there is nothing left to zip.
+        matching_paths = zip(reversed(abs_no_ext.split(os.sep)), reversed(file_no_ext.split(os.sep)))

commit.message:
Fix matching a nested pyx src coverage

This change makes the coverage plugin match paths like
`src/pkg/mod.c` with `src/pkg/mod.pyx`.

Resolves #3636

Fix matching a nested pyx src coverage

This change makes the coverage plugin match paths like
`src/pkg/mod.c` with `src/pkg/mod.pyx`.

Resolves #3636
